first_reading.title: Book of Proverbs

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 8,4]]When I behold your heavens, the work of your fingers, 
the moon and the stars which you set in place—
[[Ps 8,5]]What is man that you should be mindful of him, 
or the son of man that you should care for him?

[[Ps 8,6]]You have made him little less than the angels, 
and crowned him with glory and honor.
[[Ps 8,7]]You have given him rule over the works of your hands, 
putting all things under his feet.

[[Ps 8,8]]All sheep and oxen, 
yes, and the beasts of the field,
[[Ps 8,9]]The birds of the air, the fishes of the sea, 
and whatever swims the paths of the seas.

second_reading.title: Letter to the Romans
second_reading.text:
[[Rm 5,1]]Brothers and sisters: Since we have been justified by faith,  we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ,
[[Rm 5,2]]through whom we have gained access (by faith) to this grace in which we stand, and we boast in hope of the glory of God.
[[Rm 5,3]]Not only that, but we even boast of our afflictions, knowing that affliction produces endurance,
[[Rm 5,4]]and endurance, proven character, and proven character, hope,
[[Rm 5,5]]and hope does not disappoint, because the love of God has been poured out into our hearts through the holy Spirit that has been given to us.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
gospel.text:
[[Jn 16,12]]Jesus said to his disciples: "I have much more to tell you, but you cannot bear it now.
[[Jn 16,13]]But when he comes, the Spirit of truth, he will guide you to all truth. He will not speak on his own, but he will speak what he hears, and will declare to you the things that are coming.
[[Jn 16,14]]He will glorify me, because he will take from what is mine and declare it to you.
[[Jn 16,15]]Everything that the Father has is mine; for this reason I told you that he will take from what is mine and declare it to you."
